urls.title: £166 million cash injection for green technology and 60,000 UK jobs
urls.description: Government announces major cash injection for green technology and development as part of Green Industrial Revolution.

tweets.text:
We’re boosting green innovators all over the UK by investing £166 million in projects exploring:

💧 Hydrogen
🏭 Carbon capture
🔄 Greenhouse gas removal

This will create 60,000 well-paid green jobs. 

👉 https://t.co/EFK81ETSkH #TogetherForOurPlanet 

THREAD 1/ https://t.co/zcU9a1edi7

Training with @EnvAgency @PCCDorset @RuralCrimeTeam @DorsetCouncilUK to learn more about hazardous waste, in a bid to help tackle #FlyTipping across our beautiful County 🕵🏻‍♂️🍃🚮 Great to see CSI Sarah, D/TL Jim, CSI Bob, @CSI_AmandaK, RFC Kate and TL Paul online 👋🏻 https://t.co/YmfKWY315t

#FloodScheme #ReducingFloodRisk #Cumbria https://t.co/MdfELysdKI

urls.title: Testing and sequencing of sewage ramped up to help tackle COVID-19 outbreaks
urls.description: The innovative programme to test wastewater for traces of coronavirus (COVID-19) has ramped up sequencing capacity to support variant detection.

tweets.text:
Testing and sequencing of sewage for #COVID19 is being increased to:

▶️ understand where the virus is circulating
▶️ detect variants
▶️ help tackle outbreaks

Dr Jonathan Porter from @EnvAgency explains how this process works 👇 

More info ▶️ https://t.co/7OOtM4oIHT https://t.co/x3vvNUbr5V

tweets.text: the River Aire about to flow under Stockbridge between Riddlesden & Keighley. It was dry overnight so levels will have dropped. Downstream of the bridge the River Worth flows in to the River Aire. Snapped at 9.15am @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencyYNE #river #Aire #Keighley #Riddlesden https://t.co/M0di7CAxWJ

We’re super proud of the quality of the water at #Colwick lake.
Spring fed, and regularly tested by the @EnvAgency, it’s the cleanest clearest water you can swim in.
Come down and give it a try... 💙

https://t.co/lLxtEt2q8n https://t.co/soAbrV5Bo9

tweets.text:
Leave it in your lakes to love them! In the North West more than 90% of our drinking water comes from rivers and lakes so saving water at home means leaving it in the places you love, for both you and wildlife to enjoy.

#WaterSavingWeek https://t.co/PXeQ28hfi0

@nikjohnsongc @EnvAgency @WaterREast Is this linked to the growth agenda for the areas protection or zoning out the land to enable development? Will the ordinary folk affected by development plans be invited to have a voice please? @cam_friends @greenarteries @CPRECambs @CamLabEF @ed_nonsense
Latest Mon 9am: Moderate air pollution in 3 regions, 13 regions Low. Details at: https://t.co/nMvBRxk7uS #ukair

especially our eldest Ben. He has scaring to his brain due to CP. The constant exposure to the high levels of H2S at Walleys Quarry Landfill is a huge concern for him. He's suffering headaches & nose bleeds almost daily.. @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA when will you resolve this?
Shocking @ClareDinnisEA Were you just hoping no one checks the website?! @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @PHE_WestMids @PHE_EoEngland #stopthestink https://t.co/VtMSryGOT1

"As fast as possible" @ClareDinnisEA that is not the case though is it. This has been terrible for yrs but more recently the last 5 have been catastrophic. Our community has complained & begged the @EnvAgency for fresh air for the last 5 yrs My kids health is suffering from this https://t.co/FSVvxWLDuB

THIS THURSDAY! Join us for an evening of fascinating discussion as part of @UniofExeter Festival of Discovery with @ExeterGeography on the topic: Can we live in harmony with nature? Tickets are FREE and available until 4pm (UK time) on Thursday. Book now! https://t.co/03ULUs84UN
